screeningSummary: Prank caller with classic abduction story - admits to being dared by friends

textVariants.text: You're on the air. What's your story?
Alright, you're on. Make it quick.
YOU ARE ON THE AIR! Tell us your story!
You're on. What's this about?
You're on. So?
Oh good, a caller! What's your story?
You're on. State your experience concisely.

dialogue.speaker: Caller
dialogue.text: Okay, so this is gonna sound crazy, but I've been rehearsing what to say for three days. Last Tuesday, I was at my buddy's place out past Miller Road, maybe had a few drinks, and then... light. Coming from everywhere.

textVariants.text: Go on.
...go on.
OH WOW! Go on!!
Of course there was. Go on.
Fine. Go on.
This is great! Go on!
Continue describing the phenomenon.

dialogue.speaker: Caller
dialogue.text: Next thing I know, I'm in this room. White, no doors I could see. And there's... look, I know how this sounds, okay? But there were three of them. Gray skin, big eyes, the classic look you know from every movie ever.

textVariants.text: Three beings. What happened next?
Three of them... alright. What happened?
THREE of them?! This is UNREAL! What happened next?!
Three gray aliens. Let me guess - they did experiments?
Three of them. Okay, what'd they do?
THREE CLASSIC ALIENS! I love this! What happened?!
Three entities. Describe their behavior and any subsequent events.

dialogue.speaker: Caller
dialogue.text: They did... tests. I woke up in my buddy's backyard with scoop marks on my arm. I've been staring at those marks for three days, trying to figure out if I dreamed the whole thing or...

textVariants.text: Classic abduction story. Look, you could have gotten this from any UFO book or movie from the last fifty years. Next caller.
Right... scoop marks, classic. You know how this sounds, right? Next.
This is INCREDIBLE! Wait, scoop marks? Let me see if our team can - oh wait. NEXT CALLER!
Scoop marks. Of course. Classic abduction story, word for word. Next caller.
Scoop marks. That's the oldest trick in the book. Next caller.
SCOOP MARKS! I can't believe you just said that with a straight face! This is WHY I love this show! NEXT!
This narrative contains every conventional abduction trope. The specificity of "scoop marks" suggests external influence rather than genuine experience. Next caller.

dialogue.speaker: Caller
dialogue.text: *bursts out laughing* I'm sorry, Vern! My buddies dared me! I can't believe you bought it for like two seconds! This is why I love this show!

arcNotes: Prank call with classic abduction tropes, caller is being playful, breaks the fourth wall at the end
